2. NAEB Conference; The Birector reported on plans for the NAEB
Convention, October 27-30 in New York City. The JCET program, scheduled
for the evening of October 28 will feature Professor Baxter, television
instructor on Shakespeare. A second feature of th© evening will be a
brief summary of th© Progress Report which has been completed by the

An informal JCET meeting is scheduled on the afternoon of October
27, in Steetle's room at the Biltmore Hotel. All members are to
receive invitations to attend a dinner given by the New York Times
publisher on the evening of the 26th.
3. Land-Grant Meeting: The Director reported on plans for JCET
participation in the annual meeting of the Association ©f Land-Grant
Colleges and Universities in November in Washington, D.C. The JCET
will conduct a 2-hour general session on the morning of November 17.
Information about educational television will b© presented by*
representatives of the land-grant institutions of Iowa, Michigan,
Wisconsin, North Carolina and Oklahoma.
4. Status Report; The Director announced the completion of the
status report ”Two Years of Progress in Educational Television”. He
commended the staff on its work in preparing the document.
